attributes.action: I want to make a ban on fireworks and put in place silent fireworks
attributes.additional_details: silent fireworks instead because pets are terrified over the fireworks and can give pets trauma and if our household pets are this terrified then what about all of the wild animals, not only just the animals but people with autism and other learning disabilities are scared and petrified of loud noises. veterans with ptsd could be triggered by the loudness of fireworks. If we put a stop to loud fireworks and put silent ones in its place we could still have the beauty and “cool” factor of them
attributes.background: I want to put a stop and get rid of fireworks and put it it’s place silent ones. All shops would be to stop selling loud fireworks and silent ones be put in place

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about the noise caused by fireworks, however we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Fireworks marketed as 'silent' still produce some noise.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, a ban on fireworks or a ban on certain types of fireworks, such as aerial fireworks.

Or you may wish to sign one of these petitions, which call for similar action:

"Reduce the maximum noise level for consumer fireworks from 120 to 90 decibels"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/738192

"Reduce the sound of fireworks to under 80 decibels for humans and animals"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739674

"Limit the sale of fireworks to those running local council approved events only"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/732559
